summary.purpose: Input validation and form handling utilities using XRegExp for Unicode-aware regex patterns. Provides validation regex patterns for text, numbers, email, color codes, addresses, and more. Includes event handlers for input change, paste, and validity checking.
summary.problem_solved: Enables real-time input validation by filtering out invalid characters, supporting multiple languages via Unicode regex. Provides form data extraction/setting and duration conversion utilities.

external.why_used: React event types (ChangeEvent, ClipboardEvent, InvalidEvent) used in handler functions.
external.name: react

external.why_used: Unicode-aware regex library supporting \p{L} for Unicode letter matching across all languages.
external.name: xregexp

internal.why_used: Provides DurationValues type for duration conversion functions.

symbols.name: textRegex
symbols.description: XRegExp pattern that removes any character that is not a Unicode letter (\p{L}), space, hyphen, plus sign, dot, or comma. Uses 'gu' flags for global matching and Unicode awareness.
symbols.description_one_line: XRegExp pattern allowing only Unicode letters, spaces, hyphens, plus signs, dots, and commas.

details.what_it_does: Pattern matches any character NOT in the allowed set. Used with XRegExp.replace to strip all disallowed characters. Supports Unicode letters from all languages via \p{L}.

minimal_correct.title: Clean text input

symbols.name: ValidationType
symbols.description: Union type of all supported input validation patterns. Includes specific patterns (text, email, etc.) plus generic string type for extensibility. Used in data-validation attribute and validation handlers.
symbols.description_one_line: Union type of all supported validation patterns (text, numbers, email, color, etc.).

details.what_it_does: Defines allowed validation type values. (string & {}) allows type-safe custom strings for extensibility while preventing typos at compile time.

minimal_correct.title: Using validation types
minimal_correct.code:
const validationType: ValidationType = 'email'; // Type-safe
const customType: ValidationType = 'custom_pattern'; // Also allowed

symbols.name: handleChange
symbols.description: React event handler for input change events that clears custom validity, reads validation type from data-validation attribute, and filters input value using corresponding regex pattern. Modifies e.target.value in-place.
symbols.description_one_line: Event handler for input change events that filters characters based on validation type.

details.what_it_does: Clears previous validation messages. Reads data-validation attribute as ValidationType. Uses switch-like if-else chain to select appropriate regex pattern. Applies XRegExp.replace to remove disallowed characters from input value.

params.name: e
params.description: React change event from input element.

returns.description: Modifies e.target.value in-place with filtered content.

minimal_correct.title: Filter text input in real-time
minimal_correct.code:
<input
  type="text"
  data-validation="text"
  onChange={handleChange}
  placeholder="Letters, spaces, hyphens only"
/>

extensive_correct.title: Multi-pattern form validation
extensive_correct.code:
<form>
  <input type="text" data-validation="email" onChange={handleChange} placeholder="Email" />
  <input type="text" data-validation="numbersOnly" onChange={handleChange} placeholder="Phone" />
  <input type="text" data-validation="price" onChange={handleChange} placeholder="Price" />
</form>

symbols.name: handlePaste
symbols.description: React event handler for paste events that filters clipboard content based on data-validation attribute, then inserts cleaned text. Prevents invalid characters from being pasted into the input.
symbols.description_one_line: Event handler for paste events that filters clipboard content before insertion.

details.what_it_does: Reads clipboard text. Applies same validation pattern filtering as handleChange. Calls e.preventDefault() to block default paste. Uses document.execCommand('insertText') to insert filtered text.

params.name: e
params.description: React clipboard event from paste action.

returns.description: Inserts filtered clipboard content into input.

symbols.name: handleInvalid
symbols.description: React event handler for invalid input events (HTML5 form validation). Sets custom validity message on the input element using provided error text or default 'required' message.
symbols.description_one_line: Event handler for invalid input events that sets custom validation error message.

details.what_it_does: Calls setCustomValidity with provided error message or default 'This field is required !'. Used with HTML5 required validation to provide custom error feedback.

params.name: e
params.description: React invalid event from form validation.

params.name: requireError
params.description: Custom error message. Defaults to 'This field is required !' if not provided.

returns.description: Sets custom validity on input element.

minimal_correct.title: Custom required field error
minimal_correct.code:
<input
  type="email"
  required
  onInvalid={(e) => handleInvalid(e, 'Please enter a valid email')}
  placeholder="Email"
/>

symbols.name: useValidation
symbols.signature: (validationType: ValidationType, requireError?: string) => { onChange: Function; onPaste: Function; onInvalid: Function; 'data-validation': ValidationType }
symbols.description: Hook that returns an object containing all validation event handlers and data attribute for input element. Simplifies applying validation to input by spreading returned object as props.
symbols.description_one_line: Hook returning object with validation handlers, error message, and data attribute for input element.

details.what_it_does: Returns object with onChange, onPaste, and onInvalid handlers pre-configured for specified validation type. Also includes data-validation attribute with the type. Allows spread syntax {...useValidation(...)} on input elements.

params.name: requireError
params.description: Custom error message for validation failures.

returns.description: Object with onChange, onPaste, onInvalid handlers and data-validation attribute.

minimal_correct.title: Apply validation with hook

extensive_correct.title: Multiple validated inputs

symbols.name: getFormElementValue
symbols.description: Extracts value from named form input element and returns trimmed string. Returns empty string if element not found or has no value.
symbols.description_one_line: Extracts and trims value from named form input element.

details.what_it_does: Uses form.elements.namedItem(name) to find input by name attribute, optionally casts to HTMLInputElement, accesses value property with fallback to empty string, then trims and returns.

params.name: form
params.description: HTML form element to search within.

params.name: name
params.description: Name attribute of input element to extract value from.

returns.description: Trimmed value from input, or empty string if not found.

minimal_correct.title: Extract form field value

symbols.name: setFormElementValue
symbols.signature: (form: HTMLFormElement, name: string, newValue?: string) => void
symbols.description: Sets trimmed value on named form input element. No-op if element not found. Trims empty strings to empty string.
symbols.description_one_line: Sets trimmed value on named form input element.

details.what_it_does: Finds input by name, returns early if not found, then sets value to trimmed newValue (or empty string if undefined).

params.name: form
params.description: HTML form element to search within.

params.name: name
params.description: Name attribute of input element to set value on.

params.name: newValue
params.description: Value to set on input (will be trimmed). Defaults to empty string.

returns.description: Sets input value, no return value.

minimal_correct.title: Reset form field
minimal_correct.code:
const form = e.currentTarget as HTMLFormElement;
setFormElementValue(form, 'email'); // Clears email field

symbols.name: parseMultiSelectInput
symbols.description: Parses JSON string containing multi-select array and extracts array of 'value' properties from each object. Used with form libraries that return select options as JSON.
symbols.description_one_line: Parses JSON multi-select input and extracts array of selected values.

details.what_it_does: Parses JSON string to array. Maps over array extracting v.value from each object. Returns array of extracted values.

params.name: input

symbols.name: durationToSeconds
symbols.description: Converts DurationValues object (days, hours, minutes, seconds) to total seconds. Clamps negative values to 0 before calculation.
symbols.description_one_line: Converts DurationValues (days, hours, minutes, seconds) to total seconds.

details.what_it_does: Clamps negative values to 0. Calculates ((days*24 + hours)*60 + minutes)*60 + seconds to get total seconds.

params.name: d
params.description: Object with days, hours, minutes, seconds properties.

minimal_correct.title: Convert to seconds

symbols.name: secondsToDuration
symbols.description: Converts total seconds to DurationValues object with days, hours, minutes, and remaining seconds. Clamps input to non-negative values.
symbols.description_one_line: Converts total seconds to DurationValues (days, hours, minutes, seconds).

details.what_it_does: Clamps input to non-negative. Calculates days by dividing by 86,400. Calculates hours from remainder by dividing by 3,600. Calculates minutes from remainder by dividing by 60. Remaining value is seconds. Returns DurationValues object.

returns.description: Object with days, hours, minutes, seconds properties.

known_gaps: Validation patterns are predefined and fixed; custom patterns require code changes.
Input filtering occurs synchronously on every keystroke which could impact performance on slow devices.
document.execCommand is deprecated; future versions should use the Clipboard API.
